result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick Joseph Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Lafayette County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall pay DNA Analysis Surcharge in the amount of $250.00.
Defendant shall pay court costs in the amount of $268.00.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.

Defendant shall consent to a reasonable request of a law enforcement officer, based on probable cause, to submit to a breath, blood, saliva, or urine test for purposes of determining the quantity of alcohol or drugs in defendant's breath, blood, saliva, or urine.
Defendant shall participate in any and all counseling deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall abide by all other terms and conditions of probation deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall comply with any and all mental health regiments including the prescription of medications and/or therapy and sign all necessary releases to allow communication between treatment providers and the Department of Corrections.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations thereof.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

Case called at 3:03 PM.
Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in court with attorney Joseph Pecora.  Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court raises PSI issue.
Attorney Pecora and his client wish to proceed to sentencing.
State calls Roger McDermott
>Roger McDermott is affirmed and testifies
State moves the court to adopt the recommendation of PSI.
Attorney Pecora makes statement on behalf of his client.
Defendant makes statement to the court.
The Court:
Count 1
30 months initial confinement
36 months extended supervision.
>Costs
>AODA
>No consumption/establishments
>Submit to testing
>Other probation rules
>Counseling and Mental health treatment
***253 days sentence credit (all to this case).

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on October 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 2:51 PM.
Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in court with attorney Joseph Pecora.  Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant withdrawals plea of "NOT GUILTY" and enters a plea of "GUILTY" to Count 1.
Defendant sworn at 3:08 PM.
Court questions defendant re: plea and waiver of rights.
Court also questions attorney Pecora re: his clients plea and waiver of rights.
That there is a factual basis.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, voluntarily & intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY" to Count 1.
Attorney Pecora moves to waive PSI, for reasons stated on the record.
Attorney Pecora moves for joint recommendation of the parties.
State concurs with attorney Pecora request to waive PSI, and moves for plea agreement.
The court orders PSI to be completed by September 28, 2016.
